pros: Good supportive environment friendly staff
cons: Surgical orthopaedic hospital speciality not general acute

pros: NICE HOSPITAL GOOD TEAM PROFESSIONAL CARE DEVELOP YOUR CARRIER
cons: After COVID some things are going wrong

review_title: Culture of overlooking bullying, harassment and discrimination
pros: Can't think of any at present.
cons: Highly stressful and demoralising place to work, sickening to see how many members of staff are harassed and unfairly treated. Policies supposed to protect staff are manipulated to benefit staff at higher level who usually abuse their power to bully colleagues. HR and even union reps work together to keep all this covered up.

pros: It is ok working here
cons: It’s at the top of a big hill

pros: I had a pleasure working within the trust and it has to have been one of my favourites. The people, the benefits, it truly felt like a community.
cons: A minor thing was that the hospital is in the middle of nowhere so was difficult to get to - even then the hospital provides a shuttle bus to and from the station!

pros: nice place to work and good place to develop your career
cons: RNOH need to recruit a good staff

review_title: Horrible management and some staff are bullies
pros: Build relationships with some staff that are amazing
cons: No support. Use of administrative jargon to "comply" with "Val-you" but do not value staff

pros: orthopedic only, private and NHS patients welcome.fabulous surgeons.

pros: Good experience to work with and it pays at the end of the month
cons: Heavy workload because of the pandemic. And staffing issues add to the situation

pros: Its an encouraging environment for development

pros: Perfect place to work in
cons: No cons that i can think of

review_title: Real focus on patients and staff
pros: Great team spirit and support culture
cons: Car parking and transport a problem

pros: NHS Staff Discount was great.
cons: no progression. The team work is atrocious

pros: Diverse and positive working environment.
cons: No Cons to provide for NHS Improvement.

review_title: Small organisation with a lot of scope to level up quite quickly as many opportunities to take on more roles
pros: 9-5pm M-F, with 1x Sat every quarter. Small dept so can develop quite quickly as lots of roles to be involved in/lots of jobs to do. Good autonomy and dept line manager support
cons: Stuck in old ways. Classic/arrogant saying of "this is the RNOH way" which isn't forward thinking/progressive (old school mindset). Things take so long to progress/be reviewed. Lack of accountability when staff not performing their job roles, lack of staff engagement - it's like they don't care. Half the buildings are run down and not fit for purpose, roads not smooth or have potholes. Constant shortage of Dr's... Not safe

review_title: A NHS Trust that is working hard to look after its staff better
pros: A place where you feel that the whole organisation is working together to improve the experience for staff
cons: Not on major transport links

pros: RNOH was a great place to work, with a great working environment and determination to improve the department.
cons: Limited scope for career progression.

pros:
Specialist centre so some clinically interesting cases

Some hard working people, unfortunately they are not appreciated or recognised. 

Free wifi for staff

Free parking
cons:
Strong culture of bullying from the top down.

Clinical skills and expertise of the hospital are poor at best.

Certain departments often use other languages (non-English) when conversing
